definition[0]: to bring food or drink up from your stomach out through your mouth, because you are ill
example[0]: He had swallowed so much sea water he wanted to vomit.
example[1]: I knew I was really in trouble when I began vomiting blood.
example[2]: I vomited up most of my dinner.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say that someone throws up, is sick, or in American English gets sick:
definition[1]: food or other substances that come up from your stomach and through your mouth when you vomit
